paragraphs.title: Let's confirm SnappyData in-memory performance is 7X to 20X faster than Spark caching.
paragraphs.text:
%angular

Let's confirm SnappyData in-memory performance is 7X to 20X faster than Spark caching.

  • In this notebook we will walk you through a simple benchmark to compare performance of SnappyData with the performance of Spark 2.1.1. We load millions of rows into a cached Spark DataFrame, run some analytic queries measuring its performance and then do the same using SnappyData's column table. Preferably you should have at least 8GB of RAM reserved for this test. Please go over the Quickstart notebook as a prequisite for syntax used.
  • Monitor the Cluster, check memory consumption using Monitoring Console
    The Dashboard tab can be used to monitor the cluster and check the memory consumed by the samples.
Anonymous user needs to clone this notebook to execute the paragraphs. Clone option available in the pane next to name of the notebook at the top of the page.

msg.data:
Let's confirm SnappyData in-memory performance is 7X to 20X faster than Spark caching.

  • In this notebook we will walk you through a simple benchmark to compare performance of SnappyData with the performance of Spark 2.1.1. We load millions of rows into a cached Spark DataFrame, run some analytic queries measuring its performance and then do the same using SnappyData's column table. Preferably you should have at least 8GB of RAM reserved for this test. Please go over the Quickstart notebook as a prequisite for syntax used.
  • Monitor the Cluster, check memory consumption using Monitoring Console
    The Dashboard tab can be used to monitor the cluster and check the memory consumed by the samples.
Anonymous user needs to clone this notebook to execute the paragraphs. Clone option available in the pane next to name of the notebook at the top of the page.

paragraphs.title: Define a function "benchmark", which tells us the average time to run queries after doing initial warmups

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

msg.data:
C0
benchmark: (name: String, times: Int, warmups: Int)(f: => Unit)Unit
spark: org.apache.spark.sql.SparkSession = org.apache.spark.sql.SnappySession@5f477a0e

paragraphs.title: Create a DataFrame and temp table using Spark's range method. Cache it in Spark to get optimal performance. This will create a DataFrame of 100 million records
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

var testDF = spark.range(100000000).selectExpr("id", "concat('sym', cast((id % 100) as STRING)) as sym")
testDF.cache
testDF.createOrReplaceTempView("sparkCacheTable")

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Now run a query and to check the performance. Compute average. This will ensure it touches all records while scanning.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Clean up the JVM. This will ensure all in memory artifacts for Spark is cleaned up.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Create a SnappySession.
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

val snappyTestSession = new org.apache.spark.sql.SnappySession(sc)

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Create a similar 100 million record DataFrame
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

val testDF = snappyTestSession.range(100000000).selectExpr("id", "concat('sym', cast((id % 100) as varchar(10))) as sym")

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Create the table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

snappy.sql("drop table if exists snappyTable")
snappy.sql("create table snappyTable (id bigint not null, sym varchar(10) not null) using column")
